intro: Acalypha hassleriana var. genuina, commonly known as the Hawaiian copperleaf, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a shrub characterized by its striking copper-colored leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with unique floral structures. Its foliage is often used in traditional Hawaiian crafts and as a decorative element. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species, highlighting the need for conservation efforts.

distribution_introduced_art_desc: Acalypha hassleriana var. genuina was mainly introduced to the Pacific Islands, particularly Hawaii, as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage. The introduction of this species has led to its establishment in some natural areas, raising concerns about its potential impact on native ecosystems.
